reviews.review_msg: he only created prelectures for MATH 155 but he designed all the midterms and final. the final was literally just like the midterms, super straightforward and they were not marked hard. the midterms are just like the problem sets that are done in class. practice the material and if you know how to do them, you definitely will get an A.

MATH 155- I'm not sure why he received many bad reviews, seems more like the same individual wrote many bad reviews about him over and over. He is not bad, yeah he talks fast but he does not test you on anything you have NOT learned in class. Exams were literally straightforward, question are out of the lecture notes.
Collective opinion on this guy is that he is horrible
Curved us down do I'm cutting down his rating
hard class but fun. jf works hard and expects you to work hard. gives god grades :)
Very itneresting class but hard!  He is nice and tries hard but their is so much to learn.  JF makes you work hard but then gives you a good grade.  Made me switch to applied math.

JF is nice and kind. Very helpful and informative though his handwriting should improve. But the course sucks, really sucks. It covers a WIDE range of topics in Math, and probably for 2nd Yr undergrads, you 've never seen them. Because of that, many 4th year students taking this course.Plus, don't buy the text, never used it for a single lecture.
Course is hard, but his marking is such a generous

Hated this class so much. he said he was disappointed with the students, but honestly, he can't expect everyone to learn things the way he did, not everyone is exceptionally exceptional like him. really tough assignments with failing average and shortened final exam time, but not a shortened exam. couldn't understand him for half a semester.

Though I received a good mark in the class, I hated this course. It was more of a survey course in applied mathematics. The assignments were tedious and we were only given two hours on the final. I can imagine the material being very difficult if you haven't taken upper division courses. I am so glad this course is never being offered again.

His assignments are tough, especially since they were weighed so heavily on the grade. Exams were fairly easy with the final being scaled quite a bit. His teaching style can be dry but if something is not clear, just ask him and he'll explain really well.

He taught the material well. His writing can be difficult to interpret at times. A decent prof. However, he assigns super long and difficult assignments. You will need superior math and programming skills in order to complete these assignments. Content seems to go beyond any 2nd year math course. Take math modelling courses as late as you can!

Dr. Monagon is one of the best professors I have ever had. In class he goes through material at a very good pace so you never really get lost. His exams are very straight forward. I would recommend taking classes offered by him.
Tiny mistakes in calculations don't prevent him from being a good teacher. He assigned a lot of work, but that's the way you learn the stuff!
VERY VERY VERY VERY nice professor
